results.name: Number of balanced set partitions of {1..n}.
comment: A set partition is balanced if it has exactly as many blocks as the greatest size of a block.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..200
example: The a(1) = 1 through a(5) = 10 balanced set partitions (empty column indicated by dot):
program: (PARI) \\ D(n,k) counts balanced set partitions with k blocks.
D(n,k)={my(t=sum(i=1, k, x^i/i!) + O(x*x^n)); n!*polcoef(t^k - (t-x^k/k!)^k, n)/k!}
xref: A113547 counts set partitions by maximin.
- A010054 counts balanced strict integer partitions (A002110).
- A340600 counts unlabeled balanced multiset partitions.
